column4: I just ran apt-get update, and I got a few warnings... the last one said: "E: Some index files failed to download, they have been ignored, or old ones used instead."
W: Duplicate sources.list entry http://security.ubuntu.com feisty-security/restricted Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/security.ubu               dists_feisty-security_restricted_binary-i386_Packages)
Did you edit your sources.list by hand or with a script?
well, I used to edit it by hand, but since edgy, its been weird
are you going to make a suggestion for my sources list?
Other than line 39 and 41 being the same is looks fine, one of the repos might have just been temporarily down
well, I keep getting broken downloads and warnings from apt-get... synaptic just waits and waits for downloads that never come
Do you need the repo from cl.naist.jp ? since I have never heard of it I don't know if it is reliable or not
maybe not... trying to remember what that is... it might be CJK language support
You need to remove the noacpi option from the automagic kernel config section in your /boot/grub/menu.list
I know that, its just, it does it without telling me, then I have to go and fix it... but only after I've booted it into noacpi mode
I want it to stop messing with my head
look at line 88, that is where Ubuntu looks for what kernel parameters should be added when the menu.lst is updated
